website_summaries.verdict: This backlit keyboard boasts a long-lasting battery, nice-feeling keys, and a track pad.
pros: We like the weight of the keys and the durable design
Backlighting can be dimmed or turned off
A full charge of the battery provides 48 hours of typing and lasts 3 weeks on standby
cons: The track pad doesn't work with iOS devices, and owners used to a mouse had trouble maneuvering it
At 10 oz., it's a little heavier than others and didn't comfortably accommodate larger hands

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Although the keyboard was initially really great — super light and compact, nice typing texture, well built — one HUGE problem existed with the product that made my experience really terrible. Whenever Itype for more than 2 minutes, several of the keys start double or even triple imputing the letter (e.g. when I try to write ‘hello’, it would come out as ‘hhelllloo’). This proved to be a extreme burden to me, and this made the product virtually unusable. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kengo Shigeta

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard connected to Windows 10 for a minute. During its brief connection, keys would double and triple type. Other keys require a hard press. The keyboard is very difficult to type on under these conditions. The keyboard (fully charged) failed to work, despite being paired and connected after a short time. Sending it back and searching for a reliable keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: LPS

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect design with a big flaw
customer_reviews.text: So the design is great, I can't believe they nailed that. No one else has this small compact, easy to type on style of folding keyboard. However, the touchpad is one of those kinda grippy ones where its hard to slide your finger easily, and there's no physical buttons which makes it very hard to click/right click/click 'n drag, etc... so i returned it. i want this exact one with physical mouse buttons (and a smoother touchpad surface).
customer_reviews.author: MuEl

customer_reviews.title: trash
customer_reviews.text: This bluetooth keyboard is a good idea in theory, but it stopped working in all but a few weeks. Materials look pretty cheap and often had connection problems. I realize Bluetooth technology itself can be a bit finicky sometimes, but I have other Bluetooth devices that didn't cause me as many problems as this keyboard. Would've been tolerable if it had lasted at least a year. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too cheap to be efficient
customer_reviews.text: It is frustrating when you purchase this for travel but it doesn't work as effective as it described. Battery probably doesn't retain the charges, it turns off itself and frequently disconnect from a paired device. When I try using it, I have to charge it with charging cable connected to my laptop. It took several attempts to connect it to the paired device in order to use for a few mins. Very disappointing. I rather pay a higher dollar amount for a keyboard that works effectively without much connection or charging problems.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Gimmicky item
customer_reviews.text: As a keyboard it does it's tech job well, but Comfort has been thrown out of the window for this one. Hinges are loose, so the keyboard will have to be on a flat stable surface for it to be used. Can't use it on my lap because it'll just bend and flip. Kind of defeats the purpose of portability. Also, the gap between the sections is wide and is edged with humps - so forget touch typing even if the keyboard is on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Garab

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but split prohibits using it smoothly
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard functions fine and the touch pad is great. If you are a "Hunt and Peck" typer, it would be fine. It's not great for regular typing because of where the fold is. It straddles some important keys on the left hand and is very prohibitive to typing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard but couldn't get used to layout.
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out with my iPad and while it worked, I couldn't get used to how many of the keys are different sizes to accommodate the fold joint (T, V, F, D). Returned it for a different folding keyboard that doesn't have the trackpad but all the keys are the same size. Update: Due to my 3-star review, I now get weekly emails from the seller asking me about what they can do fix my broken product. I returned the keyboard to Amazon for a full refund (less shipping), but it wasn't broken to begin with. My not-5-star-review is due to the inherent design of the product and I will not adjust it unless they redesign the product.
customer_reviews.author: adamg

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a RaspberryPi 3 Model B V2.1
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard for several weeks while travelling with my RaspberryPi. It pairs easily, maintains charge, operates, and travels very well. Notably, the engineering allows for good hand-held operation; holding the keyboard in one hand while typing with the other. The double-click scheme works well, I had no difficulty resizing windows and dragging and dropping. One ding for old-timers is that <esc> requires a 2nd function key. If you use an old editor like vi or vim under Linux, changing from insert mode back to command mode requires an additional keypress, which is counter-intuitive if you are not accustomed to it. If you count on auto-fill for speedy entry, the <tab> key is a one-press and quicker than <esc>.
customer_reviews.author: Kennon

customer_reviews.title: Have used around 20 times over last few months and has stopped pairing w/ iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard despite the extraneous characters issues. After 4 months of occasional use, it's stopped pairing with my iPhone. The devices "see" each other, but pairing has stopped happening. No all of a sudden it pairing started working, but it took a couple hours of starting, restarting, unplugging, repairing, etc to finally get the pairing to happen again. Probably would have spent more for a better keyboard. This keyboard is great until it's not. Just changed my rating from 1 to 3 stars, you just got lucky little keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gold

customer_reviews.title: Keys stop working, don't lose you're Bluetooth connection or that's it
customer_reviews.text: Not great. Worked for awhile, battery life is good but then some keys on the left side stopped working. Not a huge deal, I just smashed them repeatedly until a response was given. But when the number keys don't consistently work, that poses a problem if you're bluetooth device needs reconnecting and you're typing the pairing code in blindly not sure if the numbers you're hitting are actually registering. Smashed it over my knee in the end, great fun.
customer_reviews.author: McManus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to carry. Worked with every device I tested. Having a USB connection capability makes it even more useful. Only complaint (minor) is size of the spacebar (tiny) and slight problem with key feel. Both are easy to get used to, and the convenience of in-your-pocket full-sized keyboard that works with all devvices is really nitce.
customer_reviews.author: CyberchuckTX

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like it. It stop connecting
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it. It stop connecting. I really wanted to love this product. It kept disconnecting with the laptop and not having the buttons in the trackpad really added to my frustrations. But they do have a model which is little expensive that has the mouse buttons.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wijeyaratne

customer_reviews.title: It folds small enough to fit in my surface case which is great, but the fold occurs between the R and ...
customer_reviews.text: Folds small, but poorly designed. I bought this instead of the insanely expensive Surface Pro 4 keyboard. It folds small enough to fit in my surface case which is great, but the fold occurs between the R and T keys making the T key smaller and much harder to press. The fold really be between G and H so that fingers do not need to cross that gap. The track pad does not have click buttons which is especially annoying because I have no way of right clicking easily. the keyboard has magnets to keep it closed which is nice, but does not stay flat when unfolded making typing on your lap challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling, and too loose when unfolding.
customer_reviews.text: Could't get it to connect to my bluetooth out of the box. Unfolding it seemed easy, but it over extends. Not so much that the very visible ribbon connectors will bend or break, but just enough to make it seem a little to far for comfort. It felt really loose. There are no clickable left and right mouse buttons, so all functions are left to touch motions. The keys feel good to the touch, but overall, if I could get it to work, I probably would have still returned it due to the cheap feel.
customer_reviews.author: Zerocole

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard | Android features
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what device the directions are referring to, but to pair with Android hold down the Android (W) button and the FN button in the lower-left corner. You'll be prompted to type a code number into the keyboard to complete pairing. You also have to hold down both of those keys to use the volume controls etc. Two-finger tapping in a web browser goes back the the previous page. I wish it had a battery indicator. A locking feature to use the keyboard on your lap would be nice too.
customer_reviews.author: LazerGh0st

customer_reviews.title: The most common reaction among the public: That is so awesome! I need to buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for school, thinking it would be great for taking notes or something but I used it for so many more things than just school. I respond to emails, writing on IG, hangout on FB and the keyboard is small enough to fit in my pocket yet big enough to comfortably type on. I used it extensively in the car (I wasn't driving I swear) and at school (quizlet saved my life). Its battery last forever, charges quickly when it does die and overall is just a spectacular electronic I would encourage everyone to invest in one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy but difficult to type on
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this keyboard. It's nice and compact, I love how it folds down and I do like the trackpad functionality (although I've found little use for it). The main problem is usability. There's a vertical raised ridge between the R and T keys that causes either the R or T to not get depressed fully when typing quickly. I'm too much of a perfectionist and my brain operates too quickly to have to go back and continually edit what I type.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Cool KeyBoard
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm totally digging this thing! A have some clients that no longer believe in using email so I receive ridiculously long text messages from them that require a ridiculously long response. On my phone I'm a "one-finger typer" and I used to dread receiving the texts because it took me so long to type a reply. Now that I'm using this keyboard, it's no longer an issue and you can't beat the price. It folds up to about 6" x 3.75" x .5".
customer_reviews.author: Michele M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my iPad and when it arrived I was typing on it within minutes. Then I noticed that a couple of the keys required a much harder press to work than any of the others. I emailed them and they responded very quickly with a couple of suggestions. I tried these to no avail and they shipped me a replacement. The new one arrived and works wonderfully. I have used it with my iPad, iPhone, MacBook and Windows PC with not a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: respibob

customer_reviews.title: light weight, easy to carry but typing not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: easy to use Bluetooth keyboard. setup is straight forward without a problem. Charging is quick and easy to carry in a bag. The keyboard typing experience is not good. The gap between R-T, F-G, C-V made typing "T, G, V" very hard. The sensitivity of the keys are poor, you could miss a lot of characters if you type fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kejia Wang

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: I got my keyboard today and first thing I did was read the manual and charge the device. It paired to my tablet with ease, and it was a lot of fun to use. Nothing beats a pocket sized keyboard with full functionality. I got it to use with Android, and it does a great job. Fits in my back pocket or side pocket of my backpack. I can charge it with Solar Panels also. This is great for outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my trip!
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful compact way to bring a keyboard with my tablet computer on a recent trip where I needed to pack light. It worked great once I got my bluetooth working on my computer. I worked on a flat surface (or with a book under the keyboard so I didn't get issues with the folding thing. It is a little odd adjusting to the keys where the fold is, but acceptable. Otherwise, the keys feel nice under my fingers.Just the right amount of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J. Young

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to pair with my phone for homework. At the time I couldn't take my laptop to work, but still wanted to catch up with my college work during my breaks. It works as advertised. If I had to list a con, it would be that it does not stay closed very well. What I did was use a rubber band to keep it closed, and slipped it into a small random bag I found laying around. Overall, good for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: I really like this. It fits in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It fits in my pocket, well-protected. The only complaints I have is that the keys are too sensitive and there is no information on how to change that. The second is the Bluetooth pairing: you have to initially add the code like really, really fast or it won't take it. Eventually, I figured that out and got connected but it was not fun. I highly recommend this product. It is well-built, durable, and arrived well within the specified time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Two things....
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, this is small and able to fit in small purse which I like. Lastly, it will not connect to my phone (galaxy S9). I sent a message saying this to the seller but got no response. 🤷‍♂️ I plan to return.
customer_reviews.author: NYRICAN

customer_reviews.title: Love the sensitivity of the pad and how versatile its ...
customer_reviews.text: A solid 5-star product. Superb for my Win 10 tablet. Love the sensitivity of the pad and how versatile its functions are, it goes beyond a traditional touch pad by offering more options tailored for tablet. And the keyboard is very easy to use and comfortably compact, with smooth bluetooth connection. All-in-one smart portable keyboard! Personally, it would be ideal, though, to had a pouch that goes with the keyboard for carrying it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: happylim

customer_reviews.title: How to make it work?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because texting is one fingered misery for a senior like me. When I found this keyboard, I was excited since I am able to type 90 words a minute. My cell phone is a Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge. I have been totally unsuccessful in getting this keyboard to connect! It will connect to my Kindle Fire but who chats on that?! There is no place to get assistance to see what the problem is. WHERE DO I GO FOR ASSISTANCE?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not flawless
customer_reviews.text: The functionality of this keyboard is great. This review is being typed with it and has become a must for me to use while on the road. The biggest hurdles are the smaller keys which results in inadvertent key strokes or missed keys. Also, because of the fact that it is bluetooth, it occasionally receives additional input signal or lags. If you need to type and be flawless, don't get a collapsing model, unless room is limited.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TOUCHPAD NOT COMPATIBLE WITH IPAD/IOS
customer_reviews.text: I am rating this product 5 stars, because it performed as designed. Keyboard & touchpad worked flawlessly with my Android phones. However the primary reason I purchased it was to use it while traveling with my iPad Mini. The keyboard worked well with the iPad but the touchpad/mouse does not work with any iOS device - which was a deal breaker for me. Let me be clear though - the fault lies with APPLE/IOS, not Jelly Comb. Apparently no iOS devices support mouse input. Yet another stupid, greedy decision made by Apple to maximize profits over flexibility and options. Want mouse support? buy a Macbook - but Apple will never see another dime from me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love that it folds to protect the keys. Works great for making notes on my iPhone while we're at appointments. Connects using Bluetooth and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great little keyboard. I use this keyboard with my android phone when I type a document. I tend to use Google docs. It works great as a keyboard. The off centered fold is a little strange at first but you do get used to it. The mouse pad is the best and worst part of the keyboard experience. It's nice to have a mouse and gesture to use when navigating through the document. But my figures do accidentally touch the pad more than I would like. Over all it's a great productivity addition to and phone or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Luthersman

customer_reviews.title: A must have for those who needs to type on phone a lot
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start? This keyboard totally saved my wrist, especially when it comes to responding to texts or emails on my work phone (iphone 8). I can no longer type using my thumbs without developing pain. It also seamlessly toggles between my Samsung S9 and the iphone.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Adorbs, high qual keyboard, for when you need that f3 button on the run.
customer_reviews.text: Love this gadget. It does exactly what I need and it was a 3 second setup. Fits easily in my purse. I just know people are going to be envious of this. The quality feels more like a $100 thing. The manual and box and the keyboard looks and feel high end. People are not going to believe I paid a quarter of that.
customer_reviews.author: afCindy

customer_reviews.title: Not so Great
customer_reviews.text: Well, when you want a foldable keyboard, you prepare to make some trade-offs. The folding is great but Keys V and T are small. I struggled with those two keys and also the space bar. You will have to adjust your standard finger placement on a standard keyboard in other to work with this.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Don't normally give reviews but this piece is Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Well Well Well worth the money for something being made in China. Full keyboard . Pros no apriecable battery drain keyboard good size not a bluetooth hog can be used with others paired disconnects from bluetooth after non use aprox 10 minutes Cons (If you can call them that) Keys tend to be alittle sensitive Careful if you tend to have fat finger syndrome
customer_reviews.author: Simple Pleasures

customer_reviews.title: Small and portable
customer_reviews.text: It's small, lightweight, portable. But, it's too small for my sausage fingers. Mouse pad isn't too friendly and too sensitive to use. It keeps zooming in and out, gli control over that. Ctrl button should be used where it's normally placed, but have to press additional fn button to make it functional. Other than that, it's okay for normal, average use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's not a bad portable keyboard. My only real issue is the track pad; it's not very friendly when it comes to needing to right or left click. I wish I had noticed the updated version before buying this one. However, it still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas J.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed at minute 5 out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Turned it on, and the bluetooth indicator on my Note 4 and also on my Kindle Fire HD 8 showed the keyboard was connected and working right away. The build is simply top notch. Seems very solid, lays flat. Keyboard is a bit smaller but no big deal. Track pad works excellent for a small device like this. Keeper all the way.
customer_reviews.author: joq1

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned. I like the design because of how it fits in my bag with the tablet. The first one lasted about a year. The second one I got I didn't get to try for a fire months. It had a couple keys that didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jford

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used this keyboard a handful of times and had it stored away up until today. It seemed the battery was dead so i connected the cord to charge it and upon disconnecting there is no life to the keyboard. It will not turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Food

customer_reviews.title: Jelly Comb - Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: I do find my left index finger difficult with the key 'v' as it's a smaller key than the rest....but for what it is, its a neat product. I do have large hands - but to criticise the numbers along the top row of this KB is unfair, as it's designed to be compactable/foldable. Another minor point is that you have to hold [FN + Backspace] to delete - but again, don't take that as a negative review as it's the nature of this beast. For my purposes of running a NUC, it does it job well.
customer_reviews.author: dFNQer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is designed to be used with any tablet or phone, including a Windows tablet, a Chrome tablet, an Android tablet or an Apple iPad. It has a dial which lets you select between three devices that have been paired
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not Great for iOS, Typing is difficult.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is super light weight, easy to pair, but the key placement is so hard to type on. Also, the responsiveness of the keys is iffy. Not very pleasant to type on. If you plan on using this with an iOS product, skip this product as that touch pad is useless and takes up valuable space. I'm disappointed I missed my opportunity to return it.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: ... touch pad is extremely small and sensitivity is really bad. Having to double tap to get a right ...
customer_reviews.text: Key layout with the fold in the middle is hard to get used to and the touch pad is extremely small and sensitivity is really bad. Having to double tap to get a right click is hard to get used to as well. Otherwise it does work but I would buy something else if I were in the market again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard/mouse to use in your living room if you have a smart TV or Android box. It folds up small, which means it's easy to throw in a end table drawer. Dropped it down a star because it doesn't lock when unfolded, so really only works well on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Jones

customer_reviews.title: This little keyboard rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's about 2/3rds the size of my normal keyboard. It fits in my coat pocket. Folds up nicely when not in use. Oh BTW I am using it to write this review. I love this thing for my tablet. only drawback in no mouse buttons. :( so when I rdp into my pc i have to rememeber the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard did connect with my tablets and i was able to type but the touch pad is/was a total waste of my money. Fire and I Pad tablets do not have cursor capability. It might be the portable keyboard for you but not for me.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be good, but it is very flimsy and the picture is misleading. If you tried to get it to stay angled, it would just fall right back down like a hinge. It gets 2 stars though because the battery is pretty good. It is also much smaller than expected
customer_reviews.author: Mell

customer_reviews.title: Lousy key switches
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has very low quality switches. Sometimes you have to hit a key 2-3 times to register a character and sometimes a single keystroke produces 2-3 characters. If you want this to save time typing on your tablet, it actually takes longer and is more difficult than the on-screen keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: David & Jill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and company
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. Manufacturer has a program of product testing definitely gonna take advantage of. Keyboard can’t connect to multiple Bluetooth devices. I have it connected to my laptop n use it only for that. Otherwise reconnections are annoying but besides that it’s an awesome product. Lots of love here.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: Connects easily, works fairly well. Has a bit of an issue with typing. You tap the keys, but some of the keys near the folds don't always register when tapped. So you spend a lot of time going back and correcting mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Doke

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again 100%
customer_reviews.text: It isn’t something I use on a daily and it’s mostly when I wanna get writing done (witch isn’t often) but it works well and can be paired with most any device via Bluetooth my father uses it more ofthen then me and he seems to enjoy answering emails with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariska

customer_reviews.title: Faulty typing!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about buying this keyboard. Unfortunately it did not meet expectations at all. Sturdy body and good quality construction and material. However, it constantly double or triple types the letters instead of 1 time and skips letters when I type. Very faulty. I returned it the next day. Return was easy.
customer_reviews.author: tamermagdy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item for size and portability!
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth keyboard is the right size and weight for on-the-go usage! Fits easily in a pocket or purse. Best used on a flat surface. Uses simple hand gestures for mouse clicks, panning and zooming on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME KEYBOARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this keyboard, the seller is really awesome great customer service! One of the best so far, The key travel on this is really good, I am very satisfied with my purchase, answering emails with this keyboard and my note 9 works like a charm esp. during my out of town travels. The bluetooth has no issues, can control the phones volume and navigates through the phone with no problems. Using this keyboard with my phone and laptop has no problem you can connect to one of them with just a press of a button awesome feature! :D MORE POWER TO YOU GUYS!
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: This is my ideal keyboard and mouse combo for my Lenovo YOGA Book.
customer_reviews.text: This is my ideal keyboard and mouse combo for my Lenovo YOGA Book. It folds up to be small and easily stored. There is enough weight to make it feel like it is a solid construction (it seems to weigh almost as much as the YOGA Book) but I prefer that over something flimsy. Now I have friends that want their own, as they are so impressed with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel DK Walker

customer_reviews.title: Turn your tablet into a communication device
customer_reviews.text: So cool... to be able to type instead of poke about on the keyboard.... very nice, would recommend to anyone who is a touch typist.... saves tons of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I do like it. Helps a lot when doing multiple communications on my smartphone.
customer_reviews.text: As in headline - it works great, portable, and helps me get through typing on my smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard and touch pad
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. Very compact. Build looks good, good response on the keys. Responsive track pad. Cons- minor. Couple keys are not full size by the left hinge,and Enter doesn't always function as I'd like (example in message Enter won't send the message, just carriage return)
customer_reviews.author: B. Harmen

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard also takes a good 4-5 seconds to wake up from sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: It works but I ended up disliking how it manages the smaller sized keys along the folding parts and sometimes my keystrokes don't always register. This keyboard also takes a good 4-5 seconds to wake up from sleep mode. I went with iClever's folding keyboard for about the same amount and I was much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: A full size key board in a small size product.
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. Unfolds to pretty much a full size key board, yet folds into a very compact piece. I would like it a little better if the board locked in the open position. The interface with my notebook computer was accomplished very quickly and I have used it to type emails several times now.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Love the Jellycomb folding keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love the Jellycomb folding keyboard. Not.much bigger than a standard cell phone when folded, but keys are all positioned well enough to type without missing a key. The only things I can mention as minor drawbacks are that - when open it doesn't 'lock' in place, and doesn't have 'feet' to elevate/angle the keyboard. These things don't entirely ruin the experience of using this very handy little keyboard. Using with Samsung Galaxy Tab.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Whittick

customer_reviews.title: Small, portable, and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect to my iPhone and works great. Simple instructions easy to learn to use.I recommend using it on a solid surface versus a soft surface. You have to type on the letters firmly.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cadena

customer_reviews.title: This is nice and small and compact for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and small and compact for travel, but to type on it was not easy. they way they split the keyboard makes it hard to hit the right keys and you have to watch what you are doing more. There are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Phatguy

customer_reviews.title: Great but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Although purchased 2 years ago, I started using it daily about 3 months ago and it worked wonderfully, battery lasted 3 days, I folded and unfolded it a few times a day. Just today some of the left side keys (a,z,q,1) stopped working altogether and others (s,x,w,2) are intermittent. Otherwise love this keyboard, will order another, but if they last one a few months with daily use will have to look for another product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Coward

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: Blue tooth to work cell phone and respond to emails remotely when not near a computer. Great for longer than normal text. Just like a normal keyboard. Feels slightly different, but after a few uses a non issue. Great invention.
customer_reviews.author: Nick McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Designed Well.
customer_reviews.text: Versatile, adaptable, easily set up. Worked with Samsung Galaxy Note and Apple iPad well. Folded, it is easy to carry. Key action is nice. Charged relatively quickly. Price is reasonable. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works very well with my Kindle HD Fire 10.1 and my LG Stylo 2 cellphone. The keyboard is small, of course, but I can type easily on it. It's compact and perfect to slip into a purse or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: A. B. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Awesome compact keyboard and great price! A+
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! Great quality for the price. It is very mobile, connected quickly and successfully to my Samsung Note 9. Works very well. I really like the size. I would definitely recommend this product to other buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this coupled to a Note 9 for office and workflow applications on Samsung Desktop Experience ("DEX") while on the go. It allows me to navigate and provide input efficiently when not at my work/home office. It paired quickly and works without issues. It's small size and inclusion of a touch pad make it ideal for portable operations.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for use with Android tablet. Keyboard connected immediately and works perfectly. Really nice to have the touchpad in the keyboard! Sturdy design that folds up very compact. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Axel Blickle

customer_reviews.title: Compact and plenty useful for anyone who needs typing on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Fully compatible with my jailbroken ipad mini 1st gen, android RCA tablet and lineageOS moto g-play - honestly use it for SSH stuff and for things I just hate thumbing it out on these screens
customer_reviews.author: Arash

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the product
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am pleased with the product. The keyboard functions well, folds up into a handy small size, and the touchpad works well with my tablet. I use this for business trips and general use in place of pulling out my bigger laptop. There is an occasional missed keystroke, but nothing unbearable. I also have fairly big fingers and it is manageable to type with.
customer_reviews.author: ELM

customer_reviews.title: feels like solid construction
customer_reviews.text: keyboard works with my kindle, laptop, and even my iphone. But the touch pad does not work with iOS. feels like solid construction, though not a great lap keyboard as it folds up. If you're using it on a flat surface though, it's awesome and amazingly portable.
customer_reviews.author: LLAsh

customer_reviews.title: received a used one, product works great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The product works great as advertised. Everything is in working order. The pairing was so simple and easy to do. The functionality is amazing. Wish it was new but happy with the product thus far.
customer_reviews.author: santas helper

customer_reviews.title: Portable, long battery.
customer_reviews.text: I've only charged it once all semester and that's all its needed. I carry it around in my backpack to use with my Galaxy Note 9 as a backup in case my Surface 3 dies during lecture or something of that nature, and its held up nicely. Some of the buttons are oddly shaped/placed because of the folding form factor, but its easy enough to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leland Rueger

customer_reviews.title: I Do Not Suggest This For A Mac.
customer_reviews.text: I Do Not Suggest This Keyboard For A Mac. It does work on a mac, but the keyboard shortcuts doesn't always match. There may be a way to configure it differently, but I'm not sure. The keyboard my be perfect for a PC however.
customer_reviews.author: LaRon D. Bennett Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice sturdy and compact keyboard. The keys are not standard in positioning which seems to be a major complaint for some reviewers but it works well for a hunt and peck kinda guy like me. The track pad is pretty responsive surprisingly for bluetooth. I'm using this keyboard with my samsung s8+ cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: The touchpad ruins it
customer_reviews.text: The lack of clickable buttons for the touchpad make it basically useless when paired without a mouse. It's perfectly decent as a keyboard, especially for the price, but the trackpad was so barely functional with my note 9 that I returned it and bought a BT mouse instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Rose

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I like how it folds up and charges the battery
customer_reviews.text: Keys had trouble syncing with my computer or android phone. Some letters kept typing on their own. Some letters would not work. Some letters printed the wrong character. Other than that I like how it folds up and charges the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Pete P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous to buy this, because others are so much more expensive, but it's great! I just got it, but it works very easily with my Galaxy S7. LOVE the folding feature and the touchpad. Will travel with this and my smaller devices instead of a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light Product and good size
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much easy to carry with the product because is light and it has a good size Good product for the price, just the space bar is a little umconfortable and the product could have some clips to fix the keyboard
customer_reviews.author: CharlyD

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Really nic build and small form factor when folded up for strage and trasnport. Connects immediately after initial pairing. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product. Instant Bluetooth connection, charge lasts forever. Good to see somebody still making good quality products. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: casakeller

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless keyboard I've used in years.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a week and love it. A little awkward feeling to type since it does not line up perfectly as a standard QWERTY keyboard. But, I love the portability, small storage size and long battery life. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: rattler0812

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far
customer_reviews.text: The touchpad is poor (curser movement is not smooth). It hasn't been used a lot so can't say much about the battery life. Otherwise, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieH

customer_reviews.title: Plesantly surprised. Works well with arduino phone and tablet as well as Linux.
customer_reviews.text: Plesantly surprised. Works well with arduino phone and tablet as well as Linux.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Does not open flat on the left side
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard does not open flat on the left side. The "T" and "V" keys are smaller than the other letter keys so it's easier to mistype.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer C.

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is great. It has a magnetic closure when folded
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great. It has a magnetic closure when folded. The mouse pad is compatible with my lg stylo 2v. Seems to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: AIK

customer_reviews.title: connects easily, and types well as long as I'm not ...
customer_reviews.text: I was wary of this little keyboard but it's a champion! Holds charge well, connects easily, and types well as long as I'm not typing too quickly. I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline C.

customer_reviews.title: convenient keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the battery life on this keyboard. My laptop keyboard died and I did not feel like replacing the laptop right away. this keyboard is great slightly smaller, but I am not fat fingering the keys. Easy to setup, convenient and easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: LSN

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Sturdy/Durable
customer_reviews.text: Works nice and very durable metal chassis. I haven't tested on a computer but I use this with my Samsung S8+ and DexStation. My only grip is the left side where it folds, Some of the keys size are truncated to allow it to fold. Not too bad for small hands. But for me, I have to carefully position my hands to avoid typos.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cool little keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Cool and compact keyboard. Not made for hardcore use. But it serves its purpose. Quickly connected to all my devices. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mass

customer_reviews.title: Keeps disconnecting.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps disconnecting. Does not want to work without disconnecting every 5 to 7 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: David Hotaling

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know if the battery life is good as I haven’t tested it yet
customer_reviews.author: HAPPY GRAMMY

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Sometimes the keyboard doesn't respond as well as I'd like, and the areas in the fold where keys are extra small can be challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Bevers

customer_reviews.title: Having to tap tap tap to wake it and wait for a bluetooth connect before I can respond to messages is annoying. C'est la vie
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could override it going to sleep after 10 minutes while it's plugged into power. Having to tap tap tap to wake it and wait for a bluetooth connect before I can respond to messages is annoying. C'est la vie.
customer_reviews.author: Decibel

customer_reviews.title: The Best Mini-Keyboard Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is simply amazing and powerful! It works across all 3 platforms my android tablet, my Windows laptop and my iMac 21.5 desktop. I would recommend this to anyone seeking for mobility, the keyboard folds really nice and has built-in magnets to keep it closed, super compact and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Walcott

customer_reviews.title: Really useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, it works wonders with my firestick and any other Bluetooth that you may need to type with Awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Thompson

product_meta.title: Folding Bluetooth Keyboard, Jelly Comb Rechargeable Portable BT Wireless Foldable Mini Keyboard with Touchpad for Tablet Samsung or Other Cell Phones (Dark Gray)
product_meta.description:
While thumb-typing or finger-swiping on your smartphone screen may be good enough for tweeting or texting, more wordy activities -- like typing long email messages, taking notes at conference sessions or writing documents like this one -- are grueling at best. For that, you need a physical keyboard.
Universal Foldable Keyboard is the perfect travel companion—its ultra-thin, lightweight, compact design lets you easily take it wherever you go so you can get more done on your tablet or smartphone no matter where you are.

Specification:
Product demension: 
11.89 x 3.82 x 0.31 inch

Touchpad demension: 
2.16 x 1.76 inch

Keyboard weight: 
200 g

Keyboard layout: 
63 keys

Transmission distance : 
up to 33feet

Capacity of lithium battery: 
140 mAH

Working voltage: 
3.7V

Sleep time: 
10 min (press any key to wake it up)
feature_bullets: ✔LIGHTWEIGHT and POWERFULL - Matte creates wonderful sense of touch. Keyboard is made of Aircraft-grade. It had been designed to be able to face up to the falls.

✔COMPATIBLE with MOST MODERN DEVICES - The high level of compatible devices suggests that you’ll use this keyboard for many Bluetooth -enabled devices. Windows, Android and iOS are compatible with keyboard. If you modify your phone or if you change your laptop/tablet, you’ll simply keep using the same keyboard. At this time this keyboard touchpad is NOT working on iOS. There are plans to fix it in future. 【This bluetooth keyboard is not compatible with any kinds of computer sticks】

✔GREAT for VACATIONS and TRAVEL - Baggage fees which will add up quickly, so better take something small on your journey. If your boyfriend loves to travel, then he possibly will need this keyboard rather than a large laptop computer, you’ll take a tiny tablet or smart phone (iPhone) and also the Jelly Comb Folding Bluetooth Keyboard.

✔RECHARGEABLE BATTERY - Users get pleasure from up to 48 hours of writing time with only one charge. The Wireless Folding Bluetooth Keyboard has a rechargeable lithium-ion battery. Standby time is up to 560 hours.

✔INCREASES PRODUCTIVITY - This wireless mini bluetooth keyboard permits users to instantly flip their tablet or phone into a tiny laptop computer for fast, comfortable typing. Touch screen writing is terribly slow compared to using a oldshool keyboard. This could be a lifesaver if your regular laptop has problems.
